result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott T Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Scott T Schroeder in court with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Colloquy.

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Sentencing argument by the State and Atty. Bloch.

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

6 Years Imprisonment 
- 3 Years of Initial Confinement
- 3 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol and or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Sign Medical Release for Agent;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- No contact with Kenneth L, Margaret S and Kristen B. .
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge.

FINE:  $2207.00  
DNA Surcharge: $250.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  City of Waukesha Police Department.
(To be paid as a condition of probation at the rate of $100.00  per month commencing the 4th month of probation)

DL REVOCATION:  36 months.

IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

ALCOHOL ASSESSMENT.

Condition Time: 1 year Huber NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith.  Credit - 1 day

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott T Schroeder in court with attorney Gerard Francis Kuchler and Atty. Bradley Bloch as a friend of the court.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Bayer states that he will resend everything to Atty. Kuchler again even though a discovery demand was not made.  

Atty. Kuchler states he hasn't received a report from lab analyst until yesterday afternoon and notes that it doesn't comply with the court's scheduling order.  Atty. Kuchler states that he did receive a witness list from the State with the officers and citizen witnesses and further that it was not filed with the court per the scheduling order.  Atty. Kuchler further notes that at the jury status he objected to motions in limine being heard the morning of trial.  Atty. Kuchler notes that the State has always intended to call Atty. Kuchler as a witness because of statements made by the defendant to the officer.  

Court is satisfied that the vehcile operation is an issue that may have Atty. Kuchler testify.  Court relieves Atty. Kuchler as counsel of record.  Defendant to go to PD's office to determine if he is available for PD appointment.  Case will be recalled at 1:30 today.  If defendant is eligible court would direct Atty. Bloch be appointed.  Atty. Bloch notes that he is no longer on the PD appointment list anymore.  As to scheduling court will address with new counsel.

Case recalled at 1:37 pm.  Atty. Kuchler as a friend of the Court.  Defendant in Court.  Atty. Bryan Bayer in court.  Defendant is not eligible for PD appointment.  Defendant sworn and questioned by the Court.  Court finds the defendant indigent for reasons stated on the record.  The Court appoints Atty. Bradley Bloch.   Court sets Atty. Bloch's rate at $125.00 per hour.  Defenadnt to repay fees at the rate of $40.00 per month comemning 1-2-15.
to exclude expert testimony filed by Atty. Kuchler

Attorney Gerard Francis Kuchler in court.   Defendant Scott T Schroeder did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

State notes that a discovery demand was never made in this case and the expert report was just requested on Thursday 12-11-14.  State did provide Atty. Kuchler today a summary of what expert will testify too.  Atty. Bayer further states that Atty. Kuchler may be called as a witness by the State and if called there would be no attorney to represent the defendant mid trial.  State notes that the defendant was driving Atty. Kuchler's car.  

Atty. Kuchler  states that based upon what was stated on the record by Atty. Bayer, Atty. Kuchler needs to withdraw as counsel of record.  Statements regarding motion to exclude expert report and notes that he now needs to obtain an expert and have a Daubert hearing.  Atty. Kuchler states he will have to have his client see if he is eligible for PD appointment but because of his new job is unsure if the defendant will qualify.  

Atty. Bayer makes additional statements.  Atty. Bayer and the court discuss why Atty. Kuchler would be called as a witness.  Additional statements by Atty. Kuchler.  

Court is satisfied that the expert report provided to Atty. Kuchler today is timely given.  Court addresses as to if Atty. Kuchler becomes a witness in the case.  Court is concerned with ineffective assistance of counsel.  Court warns Atty. Kuchler to stop interrupting the court or the court will find Atty. Kuchler in contempt.  Court notes that Atty. Kuchler should have made attempts to have  his client present.  Court removes from trial calendar.  

Atty. Kuchler requests a copy of the transcript from today's hearing before 11:00 am.  Court reporter informs she cannot have it complete by then.  Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.
from State requesting an adjournment
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Scott T Schroeder in court with attorney Gerard Francis Kuchler.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kuchler makes statements regarding motions in limine.  State notes they have not received a witness list from defense so there are no motions.   Case remains set for jury.  
State has 7 witnesses.  Defense may have 1 witness.  State believes this will take 1.5 days.  Court will pick 13 jurors.  Each side will have 5 strikes.  Court willa gain review length of trial on Tuesday morning.  Court will further address motions in limine on Tuesday morning.
Dated 12/08/14, from the State to Judge Bohren, requesting an extension to file motions in limine if matter does not resolve on 12/11/14.
